segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 5
segments.en: Numbered Discourses 5

segments.pli: 18. Upāsakavagga
segments.en: 18. A Lay Follower

segments.pli: 178. Rājāsutta
segments.en: 178. Kings

segments.pli: “Taṃ kiṃ maññatha, bhikkhave,
segments.en: “What do you think, mendicants?

segments.pli: api nu tumhehi diṭṭhaṃ vā sutaṃ vā:
segments.en: Have you ever seen or heard

segments.pli: ‘ayaṃ puriso pāṇātipātaṃ pahāya pāṇātipātā paṭiviratoti.
segments.en: of a person who has given up killing living creatures,

segments.pli: Tamenaṃ rājāno gahetvā pāṇātipātā veramaṇihetu hananti vā bandhanti vā pabbājenti vā yathāpaccayaṃ vā karontī’”ti?
segments.en: and then the kings have them arrested for that, and execute, imprison, or banish them, or do what the case requires?”

segments.pli: “No hetaṃ, bhante”.
segments.en: “No, sir.”

segments.pli: “Sādhu, bhikkhave.
segments.en: “Good, mendicants!

segments.pli: Mayāpi kho etaṃ, bhikkhave, neva diṭṭhaṃ na sutaṃ:
segments.en: I too have never seen or heard of such a thing.

segments.pli: ‘ayaṃ puriso pāṇātipātaṃ pahāya pāṇātipātā paṭiviratoti.
Tamenaṃ rājāno gahetvā pāṇātipātā veramaṇihetu hananti vā bandhanti vā pabbājenti vā yathāpaccayaṃ vā karontī’ti.
Api ca khvassa tatheva pāpakammaṃ pavedenti:
segments.en: Rather, the kings are informed of someone’s bad deed:

segments.pli: ‘ayaṃ puriso itthiṃ vā purisaṃ vā jīvitā voropesīti.
segments.en: ‘This person has murdered a man or a woman.’

segments.pli: Tamenaṃ rājāno gahetvā pāṇātipātahetu hananti vā bandhanti vā pabbājenti vā yathāpaccayaṃ vā karonti.
segments.en: Then the kings have them arrested for killing, and execute, imprison, or banish them, or do what the case requires.

segments.pli: Api nu tumhehi evarūpaṃ diṭṭhaṃ vā sutaṃ vā’”ti?
segments.en: Have you ever seen or heard of such a case?”

segments.pli: “Diṭṭhañca no, bhante, sutañca suyyissati cā”ti.
segments.en: “Sir, we have seen it and heard of it, and we will hear of it again.”

segments.pli: “Taṃ kiṃ maññatha, bhikkhave,
segments.en: “What do you think, mendicants?

segments.pli: api nu tumhehi diṭṭhaṃ vā sutaṃ vā:
segments.en: Have you ever seen or heard

segments.pli: ‘ayaṃ puriso adinnādānaṃ pahāya adinnādānā paṭiviratoti.
segments.en: of a person who has given up stealing,

segments.pli: Tamenaṃ rājāno gahetvā adinnādānā veramaṇihetu hananti vā bandhanti vā pabbājenti vā yathāpaccayaṃ vā karontī’”ti?
segments.en: and then the kings have them arrested for that …?”

segments.pli: “No hetaṃ bhante”.
segments.en: “No, sir.”

segments.pli: “Sādhu, bhikkhave.
segments.en: “Good, mendicants!

segments.pli: Mayāpi kho etaṃ, bhikkhave, neva diṭṭhaṃ na sutaṃ:
segments.en: I too have never seen or heard of such a thing.

segments.pli: ‘ayaṃ puriso adinnādānaṃ pahāya adinnādānā paṭiviratoti.
Tamenaṃ rājāno gahetvā adinnādānā veramaṇihetu hananti vā bandhanti vā pabbājenti vā yathāpaccayaṃ vā karontī’ti.
Api ca khvassa tatheva pāpakammaṃ pavedenti:
segments.en: Rather, the kings are informed of someone’s bad deed:

segments.pli: ‘ayaṃ puriso gāmā vā araññā vā adinnaṃ theyyasaṅkhātaṃ ādiyīti.
segments.en: ‘This person took something from a village or wilderness, with the intention to commit theft.’

segments.pli: Tamenaṃ rājāno gahetvā adinnādānahetu hananti vā bandhanti vā pabbājenti vā yathāpaccayaṃ vā karonti.
segments.en: Then the kings have them arrested for stealing …

segments.pli: Api nu tumhehi evarūpaṃ diṭṭhaṃ vā sutaṃ vā’”ti?
segments.en: Have you ever seen or heard of such a case?”

segments.pli: “Diṭṭhañca no, bhante, sutañca suyyissati cā”ti.
segments.en: “Sir, we have seen it and heard of it, and we will hear of it again.”

segments.pli: “Taṃ kiṃ maññatha, bhikkhave,
segments.en: “What do you think, mendicants?

segments.pli: api nu tumhehi diṭṭhaṃ vā sutaṃ vā:
segments.en: Have you ever seen or heard

segments.pli: ‘ayaṃ puriso kāmesumicchācāraṃ pahāya kāmesumicchācārā paṭiviratoti.
segments.en: of a person who has given up sexual misconduct,

segments.pli: Tamenaṃ rājāno gahetvā kāmesumicchācārā veramaṇihetu hananti vā bandhanti vā pabbājenti vā yathāpaccayaṃ vā karontī’”ti?
segments.en: and then the kings have them arrested for that …?”

segments.pli: “No hetaṃ, bhante”.
segments.en: “No, sir.”

segments.pli: “Sādhu, bhikkhave.
segments.en: “Good, mendicants!

segments.pli: Mayāpi kho etaṃ, bhikkhave, neva diṭṭhaṃ na sutaṃ:
segments.en: I too have never seen or heard of such a thing.

segments.pli: ‘ayaṃ puriso kāmesumicchācāraṃ pahāya kāmesumicchācārā paṭiviratoti.
Tamenaṃ rājāno gahetvā kāmesumicchācārā veramaṇihetu hananti vā bandhanti vā pabbājenti vā yathāpaccayaṃ vā karontī’ti.
Api ca khvassa tatheva pāpakammaṃ pavedenti:
segments.en: Rather, the kings are informed of someone’s bad deed:

segments.pli: ‘ayaṃ puriso paritthīsu parakumārīsu cārittaṃ āpajjīti.
segments.en: ‘This person had sexual relations with women or maidens under someone else’s protection.’

segments.pli: Tamenaṃ rājāno gahetvā kāmesumicchācārahetu hananti vā bandhanti vā pabbājenti vā yathāpaccayaṃ vā karonti.
segments.en: Then the kings have them arrested for that …

segments.pli: Api nu tumhehi evarūpaṃ diṭṭhaṃ vā sutaṃ vā’”ti?
segments.en: Have you ever seen or heard of such a case?”

segments.pli: “Diṭṭhañca no, bhante, sutañca suyyissati cā”ti.
segments.en: “Sir, we have seen it and heard of it, and we will hear of it again.”

segments.pli: “Taṃ kiṃ maññatha, bhikkhave,
segments.en: “What do you think, mendicants?

segments.en: Have you ever seen or heard

segments.pli: ‘ayaṃ puriso musāvādaṃ pahāya musāvādā paṭiviratoti.
segments.en: of a person who has given up lying,

segments.pli: Tamenaṃ rājāno gahetvā musāvādā veramaṇihetu hananti vā bandhanti vā pabbājenti vā yathāpaccayaṃ vā karontī’”ti?
segments.en: and then the kings have them arrested for that …?”

segments.pli: “No hetaṃ, bhante”.
segments.en: “No, sir.”

segments.pli: “Sādhu, bhikkhave.
segments.en: “Good, mendicants!

segments.pli: Mayāpi kho etaṃ, bhikkhave, neva diṭṭhaṃ na sutaṃ:
segments.en: I too have never seen or heard of such a thing.

segments.pli: ‘ayaṃ puriso musāvādaṃ pahāya musāvādā paṭiviratoti.
Tamenaṃ rājāno gahetvā musāvādā veramaṇihetu hananti vā bandhanti vā pabbājenti vā yathāpaccayaṃ vā karontī’ti.
Api ca khvassa tatheva pāpakammaṃ pavedenti:
segments.en: Rather, the kings are informed of someone’s bad deed:

segments.pli: ‘ayaṃ puriso gahapatissa vā gahapatiputtassa vā musāvādena atthaṃ pabhañjīti.
segments.en: ‘This person has ruined a householder or householder’s child by lying.’

segments.pli: Tamenaṃ rājāno gahetvā musāvādahetu hananti vā bandhanti vā pabbājenti vā yathāpaccayaṃ vā karonti.
segments.en: Then the kings have them arrested for that …

segments.en: Have you ever seen or heard of such a case?”

segments.pli: “Diṭṭhañca no, bhante, sutañca suyyissati cā”ti.
segments.en: “Sir, we have seen it and heard of it, and we will hear of it again.”

segments.pli: “Taṃ kiṃ maññatha, bhikkhave,
segments.en: “What do you think, mendicants?

segments.en: Have you ever seen or heard

segments.pli: ‘ayaṃ puriso surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhānaṃ pahāya surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhānā paṭiviratoti.
segments.en: of a person who has given up alcoholic drinks that cause negligence,

segments.pli: Tamenaṃ rājāno gahetvā surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhānā veramaṇihetu hananti vā bandhanti vā pabbājenti vā yathāpaccayaṃ vā karontī’”ti?
segments.en: and then the kings have them arrested for that, and execute, imprison, or banish them, or do what the case requires?”

segments.pli: “No hetaṃ, bhante”.
segments.en: “No, sir.”

segments.pli: “Sādhu, bhikkhave.
segments.en: “Good, mendicants!

segments.pli: Mayāpi kho etaṃ, bhikkhave, neva diṭṭhaṃ na sutaṃ:
segments.en: I too have never seen or heard of such a thing.

segments.pli: ‘ayaṃ puriso surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhānaṃ pahāya surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhānā paṭiviratoti.
Tamenaṃ rājāno gahetvā surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhānā veramaṇihetu hananti vā bandhanti vā pabbājenti vā yathāpaccayaṃ vā karontī’ti.
Api ca khvassa tatheva pāpakammaṃ pavedenti:
segments.en: Rather, the kings are informed of someone’s bad deed:

segments.pli: ‘ayaṃ puriso surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhānaṃ anuyutto itthiṃ vā purisaṃ vā jīvitā voropesi;
segments.en: ‘While under the influence of alcoholic drinks that cause negligence, this person murdered a woman or a man.

segments.pli: ayaṃ puriso surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhānaṃ anuyutto gāmā vā araññā vā adinnaṃ theyyasaṅkhātaṃ ādiyi;
segments.en: Or they stole something from a village or wilderness.

segments.pli: ayaṃ puriso surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhānaṃ anuyutto paritthīsu parakumārīsu cārittaṃ āpajji;
segments.en: Or they had sexual relations with women or maidens under someone else’s protection.

segments.pli: ayaṃ puriso surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhānaṃ anuyutto gahapatissa vā gahapatiputtassa vā musāvādena atthaṃ pabhañjīti.
segments.en: Or they ruined a householder or householder’s child by lying.’

segments.pli: Tamenaṃ rājāno gahetvā surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhānahetu hananti vā bandhanti vā pabbājenti vā yathāpaccayaṃ vā karonti.
segments.en: Then the kings have them arrested for being under the influence of alcoholic drinks that cause negligence, and execute, imprison, or banish them, or do what the case requires.

segments.pli: Api nu tumhehi evarūpaṃ diṭṭhaṃ vā sutaṃ vā’”ti?
segments.en: Have you ever seen or heard of such a case?”

segments.pli: “Diṭṭhañca no, bhante, sutañca suyyissati cā”ti.
segments.en: “Sir, we have seen it and heard of it, and we will hear of it again.”

segments.pli: Aṭṭhamaṃ.
